p: The methoxylated flavones cirsilineol ( 202) and cirsimaritin ( 203), obtained from Condea undulata (syn. Hyptis fasciculata) possess a potent activity against Helicobacter pylori exhibiting IC 90 of 3.2 and 6.3 μg/mL, respectively ( Isobe et al., 2006). This result could encourage researchers in evaluate the potential of this species as a source of agents to treat gastrointestinal diseases since the presence of this microorganism increases the relative risk of developing some clinical disorders in the upper gastrointestinal tract ( Kusters et al., 2006).
